page.title: 13EMPLOYMENT IN GREENFORD
page.content: 30 of the people we went out and asked were employed and 25 were not. Maybe most workers were at work. 15 of the unemployed were women. Most people blamed the government for unemployment. 10 of the people that worked liked their job; mostly these were office jobs, police and teachers. 17 people worked in Greenford and the other 13 mostly in Southall, Ealing or Hounslow. Half of those working had been unemployed before. Some people only took the job that they had now because they couldn't find any other job. Some people had not applied for new jobs because they did not want to work any more because of they felt too old or else they had a child to look after. Mostly teenagers were looking for a job, especially one with lots of money. Some had not taken the chance of a job because of distance or pay.
